trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for controls that are derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> class.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup that describes a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control code is persisted to the markup source and edited into the markup for the Web page.

Designers that are derived from the BaseDataBoundControlDesigner abstract base class provide design-time support for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of a designer that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control on the design surface.
When overridden in a derived class, typically unhooks events from the previous data source, and then attaches new events to the new data source.
The implementation of the ConnectToDataSource method typically involves unhooking events from the previous data source, and then attaching new events to the new data source.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a connection to a new data source was performed, typically; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the old and new data sources are the same.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a new data source for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, performs the necessary actions to set up the associated control that is derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> class.

When you override the DataBind method in a designer that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class, perform the necessary actions to set up the data-bound control so that when the design-time markup is retrieved, the control renders properly.
Typically, you will associate a design-time data source rather than the live data source, for performance reasons.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> with which this designer is associated.
Gets or sets the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource*> property for the associated control.

The DataSource property is used to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class that is associated with this designer.

The value of the DataSource property is persisted by the designer as a data-binding expression on the tag that is generated for the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> object.
The data-binding expression used by the associated control derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref>.

Gets or sets the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID*> property of the underlying <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> object.

The DataSourceID property is used to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property of the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> object.
The ID of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl"></xref> associated with the underlying <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, unhooks events from the current data source.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner"></xref> object, and optionally releases the managed resources.
The Dispose method unhooks the event handlers for the designer from all data source events.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Generates the markup that is used to render the control at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class retrieves sample data that is used for binding purposes at design time before rendering the control.
If the control is not data bound, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
If there is an error rendering the control, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
The markup used to render the control at design time.
Provides the markup that is used to render the control at design time if the control is empty or if the data source cannot be retrieved.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class retrieves sample data that is used for binding purposes at design time before rendering the control.
The empty design-time control renders as a placeholder that contains the type name and control name.
The markup used to render the control at design time with an empty data source.
Provides the markup that is used to render the control at design time when an error has occurred.
The error design-time control renders as a placeholder that contains the type name, the control name, and a message describing the error.
The <xref:System.Exception> that was thrown.
The markup used to render the control at design time when an error has occurred.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class.
The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
A control derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref>, which implements <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Called when the data source of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> object changes.
The OnDataSourceChanged method connects to the current data source.
If the current data source is different from the data source to which the control was previously connected, or `forceUpdateView` is `true`, the associated control is redrawn on the design surface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to force the update of design-time markup; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called when the data source of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl"></xref> object loads a new schema.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> event, which is raised when the schema of the data source to which the associated control is bound changes.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method to perform additional actions that are required when new schema is available.
Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class, the PreFilterProperties shadows the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the control.
It makes a copy of the attribute array of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>, and then adds these attributes to the shadowed property.

It sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute of the shadowed <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property to `false` unless the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSourceID%2A> property of the control is already set to `true`.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> containing the properties to filter.
In a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], displays a dialog box to assist the user in creating a data source.
A reference to this designer.
The type of data source.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable editing of the configuration, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to disable configuration editing.
The ID of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl"></xref> control on the page.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> object.
